intro: Terpsichore alsophilicola, commonly known as the alpine meadow bacterium, is a Gram-negative, aerobic bacterium belonging to the family Rhodobacteraceae. It is primarily found in soil and water environments, particularly in alpine and subalpine regions. This organism is known for its ability to perform phototrophic oxidation, utilizing light as an energy source. Terpsichore alsophilicola plays a role in nutrient cycling in its natural habitat. Its unique metabolic capabilities make it an interesting subject for biotechnological applications.
